snippet: The International Criminal Court in The Hague held its first public hearing on Tuesday in the dispute on where to try Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and his brother-in-law Abdullah Senussi.
abstract: International Criminal Court in The Hague holds its first public hearing in the dispute on where to try Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and Abdullah Senussi, son and brother-in-law of Col Muammar el-Qaddafi accused of war crimes; Libya has asked court to abandon its claims against the men and says it can give them a fair trial in Tripoli.
lead_paragraph: The International Criminal Court in The Hague held its first public hearing on Tuesday in the dispute on where to try Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and his brother-in-law Abdullah Senussi.

headline.seo: The Hague: Libya Claims Right To Try Qaddafi’s Son and In-Law
headline.main: The Hague: Libya Claims Right to Try Qaddafi’s Son and In-Law
headline.print_headline: The Hague: Libya Claims Right To Try Qaddafi’s Son and In-Law
